item.title: Error message: Unable to create SSPI context
item.description:
A client encountered a “Cannot generate SSPI context” error with their eConnect integration. This error typically signals a problem with Windows authentication on the SQL Server. Troubleshooting began by checking basic network connectivity between the workstation and the SQL server using ping commands to verify DNS resolution. When those checks showed no issues, the focus shifted to the SQL Server service’s configuration. Investigating the SQL Server service revealed it was configured to run under the domain Administrator account â€“ a practice generally discouraged...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/error-message-unable-to-create-sspi-context/
